alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 9:56AM PST until January 01 at 2:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .With the rainfall over night into this morning, the Skokomish River will continue to rise for a few more hours then begin to fall this afternoon.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. WAC045-310300- /O.EXT.KSEW.FL.W.0074.000000T0000Z-230101T1000Z/ /SRPW1.1.ER.221224T2018Z.221230T1115Z.230101T0700Z.NO/ 956 AM PST Fri Dec 30 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM PST Friday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest near 17.2 feet around 11 AM today and then begin to fall. The river will fall below flood stage Saturday night. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.1 feet on 12/13/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
